p: Immunomodulators may ameliorate severe COVID-19 and could be useful as adjuncts to antiviral agents ( Figure 2). Cytokine release syndrome and the observation of elevated levels of serum IL-6 and other proinflammatory cytokines in patients with severe COVID-19 has prompted trials of drugs that inhibit the IL-6 pathway, such as tocilizumab and sarilumab. Antibodies that can block the infectivity of the virus can be derived from the plasma of recovered patients or from monoclonal antibodies generated from B cells from recovered patients or phage display libraries. Convalescent plasma has been used in SARS and severe influenza ( Mair-Jenkins et al., 2015) and COVID-19 in non-randomized trials alone or as an adjunct to antiviral drugs for treatment of severe disease ( Figure 2). Antibodies can also be administered to prevent infection in individuals who are known to be at risk of infection ( Figure 2), referred to as immunoprophylaxis.
